page.title: 01Religion.
page.content: In Stalybridge town centre, there are nine churches:- Unitarian, St. Paul's, St.Georges, Holy Trinity and and Christ Church, St. Matthew's Mission, St.Peter's, Methodist, Baptist and Congregational. There is a great variety of Christian churches, and also groups of Muslims and Hindus. At Holy Trinity C.E. the congregation averages about 200, but can be more or less according to Special events. There are two Services on Sunday, at 10.30 a.m. and at 6.30 p.m., and all are different. Some are formal, some informal, with guitars and tambourines. In the middle of the week, there is a Praise Service, and an informal communion service, when all sit in a circle and say their own open prayers. For Young People there is a Sunday School; Pathfinders, which is a Bible Class; CYFA, for teenagers
